common_issues.title: PiecesOS Processing Errors and Crashes
common_issues.description: Users report processing errors, crashes when uploading content, and limitations with GPT models. This appears related to rate limiting and specific file/folder contexts. Solutions include authentication, PiecesOS updates (v11.0.0 or later), and providing detailed logs/files for issue diagnosis.

related_issues.title: I´m sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app
related_issues.text:
I´m sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.13

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

[com.pieces.pfd.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17891327/com.pieces.pfd.zip)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9a6f930-4d30-41ad-8d70-b81d9c3f7e6f)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99d91958-8fb7-4f27-9efa-9d628127e90f)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d1c630b-816c-488d-87f9-202a86d63820)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e8278a0-eca0-4b4e-bcaa-a5b195da5562)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation about Error Message

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users were experiencing an error message when using the copilot.
* The issue was traced back to rate limiting introduced recently.
* The error message was not informative and made it difficult to diagnose the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Rate limiting was impacting users unexpectedly.
* The error message was unclear and unhelpful.
* Users were unsure how to resolve the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Manually increasing rate limits for affected users.
* Implementing better error messages to inform users about rate limiting.
* Requiring authentication for cloud processing to manage rate limits effectively.
* Releasing a new version of PiecesOS with improved rate limiting and error handling.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue should be resolved for most users.
* Users experiencing the issue can follow specific steps to increase their rate limit or contact support.
* A new version of PiecesOS has been released with improved rate limiting and error messages.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users who are still experiencing the issue are encouraged to provide feedback to the developers.
* The developers are working on improving the overall rate limiting system.

**Overall, the developers have taken steps to address the rate limiting issue and improve the user experience.**

related_issues.title: I can't use any GPT models other than 'GPT-4o Mini'
related_issues.text:
I can't use any GPT models other than 'GPT-4o Mini'
### Software

Desktop Application, JetBrains, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

"I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app"

If the model is 4o Mini, everything works fine.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `int80x0` reported an issue with Copilot, encountering the message "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few minutes and try again."
* The Pieces Support Bot provided helpful resources and related issues.
* Mark, a member of the Pieces team, noted this as a common issue potentially resolved with PiecesOS 11.0.0.

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot processing failure, preventing user interaction.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark suggested either authenticating to resolve a potential rate limiting issue or investigating further if the problem persists.
* He also proposed scheduling time to discuss the issue if the problem continues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was marked as a duplicate of another issue and closed.
* Users are advised to review the referenced issue for further information and assistance.

**Additional details:**
* The issue might be related to existing issues reported on GitHub.
* @mark-at-pieces recommended checking existing issues and documentation for further information.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.0.0 breaks plugins
common_issues.description: Pieces OS version 11.0.0 causes plugin connection issues with VS Code and PHPStorm.  Error messages indicate port conflicts or incompatible plugin versions.  Potential solutions include ensuring Pieces OS is running on the correct port, updating plugins, or downgrading Pieces OS.  The Pieces development team is aware of these issues and actively working on solutions.

related_issues.title: Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working after Pieces OS update
related_issues.text:
Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working after Pieces OS update
### Software

VS Code, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Yesterday was working great. Minutes ago it prompt me to update Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers. After the update both Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working.

PHPStorm says - It looks like port 1000 is occupied by another application. Pieces OS uses this port to communicate with plugins. Please, enable Pieces OS to run on port 1000.

And Vscode says - Please update the Pieces for VS Code extension to the latest version. This version is only compatible with Pieces OS versions less than 11.0.0, and  you have 11.0.0 installed. But there isn't any Vscode plugin update.

Can you help? Is there a way to downgrade?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/973ecc53-1230-4b25-93df-b8f258273f19)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a0d82807-7d45-4279-af39-b223896bd4ca)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Rafael reported an issue with Pieces OS update triggering a false positive antivirus alert.

**Problems Identified:**

* Update flagged as suspicious access by Rafael's antivirus.
* Potential for wider user reports if the issue persists.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark acknowledged the issue and confirmed attempts to resolve it. 
* No specific solution implemented yet.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue remains unresolved.
* Mark requested additional information from Rafael.

related_issues.title: Pieces os says: port already in use if i start phpstorm with pieces plugin
related_issues.text:
Pieces os says: port already in use if i start phpstorm with pieces plugin
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0 2024-12-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

if i start my computer, pieces-os starts. Then, if i start phpstorm, there's a message: 
> It looks like port 5323 is occupied by another application. Pieces OS uses this port to communicate with plugins. Please, enable Pieces OS to run on port 5323.

Even if I kill the pieces-os on port 5323 and start up phpstorm, it still get's this error. So it looks like phpstorm is trying to start piecec-os again, and I think more than once.
I did snap refresh pieces-os => snap "pieces-os" has no updates available
php storm plugin is to be 10.0.0

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* The Pieces for Developers Suite is undergoing an update.
* The JetBrains plugin is waiting for marketplace verification and should be available within 24 hours.
* The VScode and PHPStorm plugins are also affected by this update.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces for Developers Suite is not currently working with JetBrains plugin.
* This is causing issues for developers using VScode and PHPStorm.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The JetBrains plugin is being updated and will be available soon.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being actively addressed and a fix is expected within 24 hours.

**Additional Notes:**

* The original ticket for this issue is being updated with the latest information.
* Users can refer to the existing issues and documentation for more information.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS LLM Download and Usage Issues
common_issues.description: Users report difficulties downloading LLMs due to network interruptions and an inability to use manually downloaded models. A temporary workaround involves placing a "download_success.txt" file in the model directory. Pieces is working on improvements to LLM download handling and management in upcoming releases, including download resumption and broader model support.

related_issues.title: Manually downloading a LLM
related_issues.text:
Manually downloading a LLM
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I am attempting to install Pieces with a local LLM. Unfortunately, I have an unstable network connection (which is why I want a local model in the first place.) I am trying to get Mistral-7B.

I found that Pieces wants to download the whole model (4 GB) all at once. If it fails for whatever reason, it restarts from the beginning.  This is annoying and it makes downloading virtually impossible, because my network connection does not stay long enough to pull 4GB in one go.

I have figured out where the file is being downloaded to and from, and managed to download it manually with wget. Now the problem is that Pieces refuses to recognize it. Even if I put it in the right place, the Pieces app stil shows the Download button in the UI, and clicking Download truncates the file to zero and starts the download from the beginning.

I tried to edit models.db and change "downloaded" to true in the relevant line, but it has no effect.

Is there anything else I could do?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Importing a manually downloaded model is currently not supported.
* Pieces performs internal processing on downloaded models before they can be used.
* A failed download will trigger a complete model deletion for data integrity.

**Problems Identified:**

* Users cannot utilize manually downloaded models.
* Incomplete downloads due to connection problems lead to the loss of the entire model file.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Adding an empty "download_success.txt" file in the specified directory and restarting Pieces might resolve the current issue (temporary workaround).
* A new upcoming release will overhaul Pieces' on-device LLM infrastructure:
    * Enabling restarting of incomplete downloads.
    * Improving overall download handling and management.  

**Current Status/Outcome:**
- Temporary fix available.
- Major update with enhanced download features and fixes expected soon.


This conversation indicates ongoing development in Pieces regarding handling LLM models and download management. Users experiencing the "unable to import" issue may consider the workaround or await the forthcoming update for a permanent solution.

related_issues.title: Can't turn on long term memory engine
related_issues.text:
Can't turn on long term memory engine
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i keep clicking on the button but the ltm engine wont turn on
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d91ee8ce-b8e1-4f28-9785-02d488d88775)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User (@sh02sahil) experiencing issues with the LTM engine not starting. 
* User tried restarting Pieces OS, switching to Cloud Mode, but the issue persisted.
* Existing Issues and documentation did not resolve the issue.

**Problems identified:**

* LTM engine not starting in Pieces.
* Release not available for the user to test the potential fix.
* User needed further assistance with several issues.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested:
    * a new release with a potential fix.
    * checking for updates in POS 24.
    * scheduling a call to discuss the issues in detail.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User scheduled a call to discuss the issues with Mark.
* Mark-at-pieces confirmed a major release today, suggesting the user to try checking for updates.

**Additional remarks:**

* The user was not able to test the potential fix due to the release not being available yet.
* The conversation ended with the next steps being the scheduled call to discuss the issues further.

related_issues.title: Taskbar is not able to be  used while accessing pieces
related_issues.text:
Taskbar is not able to be  used while accessing pieces
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The issue is that my task bar automatiically hides and we can only access it if we hover to the bottom of our screen.For all the apps except the pieces the hover works but when using pieces and hover for the taskbar the taskbar not appears
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @Harisankar705 reported an issue.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* The user might find related issues helpful (e.g., white screen, stuck OS, scrolling issues).

**Problems Identified:**

* The user's specific issue is not described in the conversation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user will receive a follow-up within 24 hours.
* Resources are provided for the user to explore while waiting (e.g., existing issues, documentation, YouTube channel).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being addressed by the Pieces team.
* The user is awaiting further communication.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation is from December 17, 2024, so more recent information may be available.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS processing errors and crashes:** This issue is the most frequent and has the highest activity level. Focus on addressing rate limiting, file/folder context issues, and improving error messages.

**Address Pieces OS 11.0.0 plugin compatibility:** Investigate and resolve the plugin connection issues with VS Code and PHPStorm caused by the latest Pieces OS update. Ensure clear communication and solutions for affected users.

**Improve LLM download and management:** Address the difficulties users face when downloading LLMs, including network interruptions and inability to use manually downloaded models. Implement download resumption and expand model support.

**Enhance Pieces Desktop App stability:** Investigate and resolve crashes, connection issues, and UI conflicts reported by users. Improve bug reporting mechanisms and gather detailed system information for troubleshooting.

**Proactively monitor and address issues with new PiecesOS releases:** Implement rigorous testing and release procedures to minimize the impact of bugs and compatibility issues in future updates. Communicate known issues and workarounds to users promptly.
**Consider creating a dedicated support channel for PiecesOS and plugin issues:** This would help streamline support requests and ensure that users receive timely and relevant assistance.

**Develop comprehensive documentation and troubleshooting guides:** Provide clear instructions on resolving common issues, including LLM download problems, plugin conflicts, and PiecesOS errors. Make this information easily accessible within the app and on the Pieces website.

**Gather user feedback on specific error messages and support experiences:** Use this feedback to improve the clarity and helpfulness of error messages and identify areas for improvement in the support process.
